result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis Deshon Hamilton

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF254, #22CF306, #22CF472 called at 2:39pm 
Defendant Marquis Deshon Hamilton in court, in custody, with Attorney Michael Short.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Initial Appearance is held in #22CF472: 
--Attorney Short indicates that he will be counsel of record in the case.  
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by the Defense; ADA Shock agrees to the December 2nd scheduled date for the hearing. 
--The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 as referred to in the Criminal Complaint and the Victim Witness Key 
--not to possess any firearms 
recess 2:53pm 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on November 23rd at 10:00am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing in Case #22CF472 and Status Conference on the other cases--all on December 2nd at 8:30am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:34 PM 
Defendant Marquis Deshon Hamilton in court with Attorney MICHAEL J. SHORT.   Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Mr. Hamilton waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 1:40pm  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/6/22 at 11:00am    (2) Status Conference on 8/22/22 at 9:30am
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 1:41pm 
Defendant Marquis Deshon Hamilton appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (the PD appears for bond-purposes only; no indication was given whether an eligibility determination was completed ).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given.  Mr. Hamilton indicates he intends to seek counsel. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance, tolling preliminary hearing time limits. The Court preserves the Defense objections 

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond with no special conditions.
recess 1:47pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on June 17th at 1:15pm
